content.prompt: Which of the following best explains the author’s use of the qualifier “probably” in the first sentence of the seventh paragraph?

choices.label: Like Crazy Horse, the author shows humility by not asserting his own truth.
By acknowledging the probability of error, the author gains readers’ sympathy.
The author has credible evidence of only two public speeches by Crazy Horse.
The author does not want to contradict his earlier claim that Crazy Horse was “shy.”

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Explain ways claims are qualified through modifiers, counterarguments, and alternative perspectives.
